results.title: Gateway to Asia
results.brief_description: With the distance between Canada and Russia, China and India cut by high-speed planes, new international links are being forged. In this Pacific world, British Columbia is a unit of growing importance. In a brief survey of the province, Gateway to Asia covers the people, natural resources, industries, and some of the social problems of British Columbia. Located on the Pacific Coast, it is the jumping-off place for planes bound for the Orient and Russia, and a vital link between the rest of Canada and her neighbors in the Far East. Narrated by Lorne Greene.

results.title: Gateway to adventure
results.creator_credit: Rayant Pictures, Anthony Gilkison and Darcy Conyers
results.brief_description: A lively impression of the variety and adventure which characterises the training of Naval Officer Cadets at the renowned Britannia Royal Naval College, Dartmouth. Includes exercises on land, at sea and in the air; mock engagement between a ship at the Dartmouth Squadron and an “enemy” submarine, and a passing-out parade, with all its attendant ceremonial, held in the presence of Admiral of the Fleet, the Earl Mountbatten of Burma.

results.title: Gateway to a city
results.creator_credit: Roderick Films International and Roderick Johnston
results.brief_description: A brief history of the area near Circular Quay, Sydney, known as The Rocks. Shows how this valuable site has become a neglected backwater and indicates, by the use of models, how it will look in the near future after redevelopment.

results.title: Gates of power
results.brief_description: A description of some of the hydro-electric schemes in the British Isles showing how this power is harnessed and some of the difficulties which have to be overcome. The film also shows the Karapiro Dam under construction in New Zealand which, when completed, will be one of the largest in the world. Turbo-generators, made in Britain, are being installed at this dam.

results.title: Gate [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Peter Carstairs, Karen Radzyner and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description: Over the duration of a smoko, 3 sheep station workers (Joel Edgerton, Tony Ryan and Brett Wood) deliberate over which one of them left the gate open and allowed 800 sheep to escape. With remarkable ingenuity and careful questioning, they get to the bottom of the matter.

results.title: Gastronomy = La Gastronomie
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ian McLaren and Douglas Jackson
results.brief_description: Quebec has a long tradition of good eating, but the haute cuisine served at the autumn banquet of the ‘Le Club Prosper Montagne’ is something that must be seen to be believed. This club is one of the oldest, most exclusive dining clubs in Quebec. Through the film cameras, you savour the elaborate, twelve course dinner with vintage wines, prepared by Chef of the Year Marcel Kretz at Hotel La Sapiniere in the Laurentians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Ian McLaren and Douglas Jackson

results.title: Gastro-intestinal cancer: problem of early diagnosis
results.brief_description: A survey of cancer reviewing salient points in diagnosis and stressing importance of early discovery and treatment in lowering mortality figures. The film was produced for use by general practitioners, residents, particularly of internal medicine, interns and medical students in their clinical years.

results.title: Gastro-enteritis in infancy
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Prevention of Cross Infection”.
Illustrates the prevention of cross-infection by contact and the techniques of cubicle nursing of specific complaints. A specific case is analysed, showing the general precautionary techniques of “barrier” nursing, and the possible consequences if even a single rule is not observed.

results.title: Gaston's recital = Le Violon de Gaston
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Larose, Laurence Pare and Andre Melancon
results.brief_description: This short dramatic film about a young boy torn between conflicting loyalties is resolved with humor and wisdom. Sunday, two o’clock, is zero hour for Gaston. He must be in two places at once: performing at a music recital and playing hockey with his teammates. The game is won, and Gaston plays his piece in his hockey outfit. The well-developed script touches on obedience, loyalty, and the art of compromise. Cast: Mireille Bienvenu, Claude Jolicoeur, Monique Larocque, Andre Poirier.
